Description: Papyrus written with black ink with demotic text recto (10 ll.) and verso (1 l.). Thompson's MS Catalogue (concerning all fragments P BM EA 10382 [he lists 10 of them]): "not mounted, kept in portfolio in 10 sheets of paper. apparently disconnected documents & fragments, but all of c. Persian period (BC. 525-332)".
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (48863) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/48863)
Condition: Papyrus Survey: Condition Details: Papyrus: displaced fragments Black ink Mount Details: Sandwich: glass Binding: magic tape Binding: copydex self adhesive carpet tape Object Priority: A Mount Priority: A Overall Condition: A Curatorial condition comment: fair (incomplete)
